abstract: Verizon says that until its recent $99 unlimited voice wireless plan, only 4 percent of customers chose to pay $99 or more. Now it’s getting 13 percent of its customers at that level. AT&T last week reported a similar shift.
snippet: Verizon says that until its recent $99 unlimited voice wireless plan, only 4 percent of customers chose to pay $99 or more. Now it’s getting 13 percent of its customers at that level. AT&T last week reported a similar shift.
lead_paragraph: If I see the balding guy in the Verizon commercial marching in front of the New Orleans Hard Hat Band one more time, I’m going to pull my FiOS TV cable out of the wall.

headline.main: Verizon Shows How to Make Money by Cutting Prices
